> Message : Exception setting "ConnectionString": "Keyword not supported: 'authentication'."

Perhaps you need to install SQL nuget package to get full features.
I installed the "mssql for Visual Studio Code" package and the error is still present.
Maybe link to a gist helps you https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/6724#issuecomment-552141268

Thanks iSazonov, I read the link and followed the recommendation ([[Microsoft.Data.SqlClient with PowerShell]](https://gist.github.com/MartinHBA/86c6014175758a07b09fa7bb76ba8e27)) and the DB I'm attempting to read does not support windows logins.  It must be Active Directory Integrated.

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.data.sqlclient.sqlconnection.connectionstring?view=netframework-4.8
SqlConnection.ConnectionString Property (System.Data.SqlClient)
Gets or sets the string used to open a SQL Server database.
looks like core version **System.Data.SqlClient** does not support AAD and I guess you wanted use AAD https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-mssql/issues/1159 try to use namespace **Microsoft.Data.SqlClient** if possible (with C#) or use **System.Data.Odbc** namespace with PowerShell with latest ODBC driver or another option undeprecated OleDb 18.3 with namespace **System.Data.Oledb**

I finally had time to get back to this.  I've started the to move to the ODBC since C# isn't really an option.  

Is there any intention to add support for AAD upon release?

@sonnyjrob per this [MS blog](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/dotnet/introducing-the-new-microsoftdatasqlclient/) do not expect any new features to System.Data.SqlClient, all new features will be only with new Microsoft.Data.SqlClient
Close as stale issue. Feel free to continue discussion.
